title: If Mordekaiser Isn't the Ace of Spades...
body:
... perhaps {{champion:83}} could take up that position?

EDIT: Nevermind, that's {{champion:81}} . Still, Yorick Mori could still fit into the card-themed skin line, considering his weapon's a shovel.

replies.body: We considered making Mordekaiser the Ace of Spades, but we felt that the shape language for 'clubs' was much stronger for his weapon.

I saw that, and I think that was absolutely the right call, since KoC Mordekaiser looks fantastic and appropriate for the card theme.

Regarding the attributions, though, is there a specific reason behind card assignments besides shape expression? For example, Morde's attitude, appearance and lore are all pretty fitting for a king, but what made, say, Ezreal the Ace of Spades, as opposed to the Jack of Diamonds?
Actually, yes! There's an idiom - cocky as the king of **spades** - and we felt that spades would be a good personality fit for Ezreal!

Well ace of spades fits the naming scheme
now there is one skin per face card, and per suit: 
jack of hearts {{champion:4}}, queen of diamonds {{champion:134}}, king of clubs {{champion:82}}, ace of spades {{champion:81}} 
It's actually a pretty cool system because the strength of the suit increases with the strength of the card, for most card games.
i.e. king is better than jack, and clubs are better than hearts. 

On the other hand, that means {{champion:81}} op, buff {{champion:4}}, and we have no idea how {{champion:35}}  fits in.

Ace of Spades Ezreal needs skin-tier bump to be given updated particles.

His only other skin with updated particles is PFE... among his vast repertoire of skins.

Also, super hard to tell its Ezreal in game. Lacks champion readability.

And Syndra needs that 975 treatment to so she can have recolored/updated particles.
Yorick is planned for a {{champion:14}} level relaunch so don't expect any sling until that is completed.
